comment_data.body: Is there a small practical example we can show here? E.g. mentioning 'spell' explicitly would be very helpful.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -358,6 +358,8 @@ TREESITTER
   descendant itself.
 • |LanguageTree:parse()| optionally supports asynchronous invocation, which is
   activated by passing the `on_parse` callback parameter.
+• |vim.treesitter.query.set()| can now inherit and/or extend runtime file
+  queries in addition to overriding.

comment_data.body: Good idea. I'll add the example to `treesitter.txt` though.

+• |vim.treesitter.query.set()| can now inherit and/or extend runtime file

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
    following code: >lua
```
(no need to call this out in this specific spot)

 set({lang}, {query_name}, {text})                 *vim.treesitter.query.set()*
     Sets the runtime query named {query_name} for {lang}
 
-    This allows users to override any runtime files and/or configuration set
-    by plugins.
+    This allows users to override or extend any runtime files and/or
+    configuration set by plugins.

comment_data.body:
Fair enough. I just added this as this is what `M.parse` does:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/bad3c9e5eccaf8d273bf52e68c82ae1c7dabf6a8/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/query.lua#L346

comment_regular_data.body: I'll wait for https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/30227 to be merged first, since the changes in `_memoize` might be relevant in this PR.
Question: Even with `_memoize._invalidate`, how do we determine the query order after deleting some extension? Or is it going to be kept with the order of when it's added in?
I think any manual `set` should (and probably automatically will) come after queries on `rtp`. Note that _deleting_ queries is not part of this proposal.
@clason Let me know if this implementation matches what you had in mind for the feature :)
